alert.note: Alert for Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 3:52PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Flagler and southeastern St. Johns Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 351 PM EDT, an outflow boundary will zipper down the Flagler county coast along the inland advancing east coast sea breeze. Thunderstorms will quickly develop and impact areas along and near the I-95 corridor toward the coast. Funnel clouds, gusty winds and very heavy rainfall are likely as these storms intensity. HAZARD...Landspouts and wind gust 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Palm Coast, Flagler Beach, Bunnell, Marineland, Crescent Beach, Beverly Beach and Espanola. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Flagler; Coastal St. Johns; Inland Flagler; Inland St. Johns
